result.markdown:
--- title: "Introduction to Data Science with `R`" subtitle: "EDLD 651" author: "Joe Nese" institute: "University of Oregon
Fall 2023" format: revealjs: theme: default highlight-style: github incremental: false fig-width: 9 fig-height: 3.5 scrollable: true execute: echo: false warning: false --- ::: {.cell} ::: ## How many beans are in the jar? {.center background-color="#CC79A7"} (keep your guess to yourself!) ## Introduction to the Course ### Week 1 # Agenda - Introductions - Syllabus - Introduce `R` **Learning Objectives** - Understand the course requirements - Get you excited about `R`! ## About me {.scrollable .smaller} - BA: UC Santa Barbara - PhD, School Psychology: University of Maryland - Behavioral Research & Teaching ([BRT](http://brtprojects.org)) at UO since 2009 - Research Associate Professor **Research** * Applied statistical methods to measure and monitor student growth * Inform the applied research methodologies used by researchers * Developing and improving systems that support data-based decision making using advanced technologies to influence teachers' instructional practices and increase student achievement + [CORE](https://jnese.github.io/core-blog/) and [CORE II](https://jnese.github.io/coreprosody) + Inclusive Skill-building Learning Approach ([ISLA](https://blogs.uoregon.edu/neselabs/isla/)) **Teaching** * EDLD 651 - this one! * EDLD 654 - Applied Machine Learning for Educational Data Scientists * EDLD 609 - Data Science Capstone ## About you Please introduce yourself 1. Name and program/year of study 2. Why you want to learn `R`? 3. Do you have any `R` experience? 4. Tell me whatever you'd like me and the class to know (e.g., pronouns, circumstances) 5. How many beans are in the jar? + No changing your answer! *Academic integrity!* # The Great Bean Experiment! {.center background-color="#CC79A7"} ## Why is this important? * reproducibility * transparency * open data and code ## Create a journal article! with `quarto` ## Create slides! with `quarto` Like these! ## Create a website! with `{blogdown}`, `{distill}`, `{bookdown}`, `{rmarkdown}`, or `{quarto}` :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} [**For a project**](https://jnese.github.io/coreprosody/) ![](./images/coreprosody.PNG) ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} [**For this class**](https://uo-datasci-specialization.github.io/c1-intro-fall-2021/) ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/edld651home.png) ::: ::: ::: :::: ## Create a dashboard! with `{flexdashboard}`! ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/dashboard-ex.png){width=100%} ::: ::: ## Create an app! with `{shiny}`! ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/shiny-ex.png){width=100%} ::: ::: --- ## Create a poster! with `{posterdown}`! ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/poster_ex.png){width=100%} ::: ::: ## ![](https://media3.giphy.com/media/l0Ex6Ut39Zj7DzJn2/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47nuxorxxyd90ssv30og5pfaysh3bmmj48f7h8exuc&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g) ## Why is `R` awesome? **Data visualizations** - `{ggplot2}` -- your default by the end of this class, really powerful - `{plotly}` -- interactive data visualizations - `{shiny}` â€“- interactive data communications . . . **Web** - `{blogdown}`, `{distill}`, `{bookdown}`, `quarto` â€“- build your own website - `{rvest}` â€“- scrape web data . . . **Modeling** - `{lme4}` â€“- multilevel modeling - `{lavaan}` â€“- SEM - `{tidymodels}` â€“- machine learning . . . **Workflow!** - RStudio projects - `{here}` ## Acknowledgements This course, and much of the materials prepared and content presented, was originally developed by [Daniel Anderson](www.datalorax.com) * [Alison Hill](https://twitter.com/apreshill), [Chester Ismay](https://twitter.com/old_man_chester), and [Andrew Bray](https://andrewpbray.github.io/) helped Daniel design the content for this course and the specialization as a whole ## What this class is about Celebrating successes! . . . ![](https://media2.giphy.com/media/OcZp0maz6ALok/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47nmgpnfbcocno4uyal5vpv1orgvnyw028hqgsisak&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g){width=45%} ## Dr. Richard Feynman American theoretical physicist, Nobel Laureate . . . ![](./images/feynman_teach.png) ## What this class is about Celebrating failures! . . . ![](https://media0.giphy.com/media/g0KKEpxfjIPS7RpZPJ/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47gp0ldlgtsjg7b2bwvx5fa7x10j9taot0f8hsrdtp&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g){width=80%} ## What does Richard Feynman have to say about failing? . . . ![](./images/feynman_fail.png) ## What this class is about Celebrating trying! . . . ![](https://media0.giphy.com/media/26ybwvTX4DTkwst6U/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e4784dexf3mrjfpve138d14ggn7x18kqt8fa4n17ua2&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g){width=60%} ## Very smart person Richard Feynman said: . . . ![](./images/feynman_trying.png) ## What this class is about Learning to problem solve! . . . ![](./images/problemsolved.gif){width=65%} ## Richard? . . . ![](./images/feynman_problemsolve.png) # This class... {.smaller} **...is** - data visualization - data structuring and manipulations - reproducible workflows - a LOT (content and assignments at a fast pace) . . . **...is not** - all encompassing - a statistics course + but we'll use some stats in examples ## Sharing Sometimes I may ask people to share with the class something they have learned. - A success, a new `{package}` or `function()` - *Completely* voluntary + **BUT**, you might get a hex sticker ðŸŽ‰ . . . ![](https://www.kdnuggets.com/wp-content/uploads/r-packages.png) ## A sharing example :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} > "I made this cool figure! > > I used the `{gghighlight}` package for the first time! > > And I annoted my facets separately!" ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ![](./images/share_ex.png) ::: :::: ## Another sharing example :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} > "I went to re-run my â€˜cool figureâ€™ a couple months later and my code did not work! > >I spent [*mumble mumble*] minutes getting it to work again!" ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ![](./images/share_ex.png) ::: :::: ## Courageous Conversations with Me * Creating norms of openness, understanding, and development * An opportunity for us to grow * Assume positive intent * Critical for my work (and yours) ::: aside Credit: Dr. Rhonda Nese ::: # Syllabus ## Course Learning Outcomes - Understand the R package ecosystem + how to find, install, load, and learn about them - Read "flat" (i.e., rectangular) datasets into `R` - Perform basic data manipulations / transformations in R with the `{tidyverse}` + leverage appropriate functions for introductory data science tasks + prepare data using scripts and reproducible workflows - Use version control with `R` via git and GitHub - Use Quarto to create reproducible dynamic reports - Understand and create different types of data visualizations ## Course Site **https://jnese.github.io/intro-DS-R-fall-2023/index.html** * schedule * slides (posted *before* each class) * assignments (posted *after* each class) * syllabus * data **Canvas** * submit assignments * course announcements

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
